In terms of race, I would consider Halfling if you are going Dex based single Kama. It has +2 dex as a racial bonus, and has +1 AB / +1 AC / other bonuses from small stature.
However Elf is stronger than halfling if you are going dex based dual Kama. 
It is possible to fit ITWF Kama in the build, and with the cleric AB buffs, quite attractive. Human should be considered an option as your build will be feat starved if you go ITWF.

I would drop Cha down to 8, increase Int to 14. This increases both skill points and death attack DC a little.

I like Weapon Finesse at level 3. This is an excellent choice.

I would drop Dodge, Expertise, IC: Kama for Two-Weapon Fighting, Ambidexterity and Improved Two-Weapon Fighting if you remain an elf. 

I would take Monk 5 and 6 at level 21 and 22 to access improved knockdown.

Then Assassin 9 at level 23 for Improved Invisibility. 

Then cleric / assassin as you wish. Preferably cleric 12 sooner rather than later, as the cleric buffs are useful, but you may wish for a late spellcraft skill dump.

I suggest taking Epic Weapon Focus: Kama at level 21, Epic Prowess, then put the rest into Great Dexterity, aiming for an ending even dexterity score at level 40.

You should have an excellent AB from all the bonus Assassin feats as a result, plus great bonuses to stealth skills which will be important for HiPS (I understand Arkhalia grants Assassin HiPS?)/death attack attempts.

From that point onwards I would want to assess the saves / HP / AB etc of the build and decide further as to what to choose. It might be reasonable to try to enhance some of the other stats it is a matter of balance. At level 40 I would probably want unbuffed HP 300-350 perhaps, and most saves above 20 if possible if I am playing solo, but the targets might adjust depending on the overall balance.

Overall it looks great to me. Its a cleric with huge AB boosts and other buffs, and a dual kama sneaker with up to 10 attacks / round, 11d6 sneak attack damage can use ranged weapons whenever desired.
It looks like the kind of build I would love to play, especially if Assassin gets HiPS

These are my suggestions RE optimising:
I would suggest elf over halfling if you dual wield Kamas. Because Kamas are small weapons, small characters such as Halflings will have a -2 AB penalty when dual wielding them. 
Whereas an Elf will not have that problem.
Elf will also find it easier to knockdown opponents for even more sneak attack damage.
If you decide to single wield a Kama (*only* doing up to 8 attacks / round) then Halfling offers a lot.

A base AB of 42 plus cleric buffs is excellent, and assassin provides the extra AB compared to rogue from its Great Dexterity bonus feats.. 
Combined with sneaking/flanking attacks, or attacking knocked down opponents who have their tumble/Dodge/Dex AC destroyed the 'in practice AB' will be even higher.
I would drop AB down by 1-2 points if this guy is taken solo to balance the build a little for:
- more HP (ie higher starting constitution, toughness feat) -> aim for around 300-350 HP
- more fortitude save (ie great fortitude/epic fortitude feats) 
- maybe epic skill focus: Hide and Move Silently given you have HiPS
But in a party this matters less, others can tank or disable enemies for you, and you can do your role which is to kill things rapidly with death/sneak attack 5-10% more effectively with the extra AB.

Skillswise I do not know the Arkhalia environment well enough, but usually I would aim UMD 33 modified (for 0% spell failure from scrolls), Tumble 40 (+8AC),  and take the points out of discipline to achieve this.

Thanks Orion.

If I go with this attribute stats:

Str 10, Dex 17, Con 12, Wis 15, Int 14, Cha 8

Even tho this seems to semi gimp AC at 15 to start. I can do ranged and probably survive until 4th lev, until goto 18 at 4th, then gear, cleric buffs, should get me to 8th lev, where goto Wis 16. Then can go Dex rest of way. That 1 less point of Wis at 15 instead of 16, is worth 2 stats points which can be used to start with a 12 Con, instead of 10 Con.

That alone should net 40 more HP, to 316 HP at 40th lev.

That should be enough. Build is so feat starved, that dont want to spend a feat slot on Toughness.

And also since AB, and AC so high, I either shouldnt be hit, or should be hitting more then being hit, and if I am death attacking, then I should be paralyzing, death attacking, sneak attacking, instead of being hit.

And with Evasion, and high Will, Reflex saves, I shouldnt be taking lots of Spell damage, trap damage, etc.

So 316 Hp should be just fine.

As far as great fortitude feats, I have seen how vulnerable the build is to poison, diseases, etc, that wreck my other attributes, Saves, AC, AB, etc

I can sacrifice 1 great dex feat and go with Great Fortitude, that and the +1 Con bonus should give 3, 4 more points to Fort Save and make it about equal at about 25, 26, 27, 28, to my Will save that at 26,27,28

I'll go with Elf.

I will give up discipline. If I am paralyzing, death attacking opponents, I am probably not being disarmed, and not being knocked down.

I can use those 20 points for Hide, UMD, Tumble, Disable Device.

So because of that I dont think I will use Skill focus.

I just dont have the room for all your different feat suggestions, because pf how feat starved, and because of how valuable AB, AC.

Also the +3 from Skill focus wont make that much of a difference.

I'll go into the CBC, make those changes, and then repost it.

Thanks for your help.

Mike

Going with Elf.

Going with Epic Fortitude, in place of 1 of the great dex's, so going with 6, great dex feats, and 4 non great dex epic feats.
